text.p: Now use the Structural Tension idea and create the objectives (try to keep it around 5 objectives) that would get you from your Current Reality to your Intermediate End Result #1. This portion of the assignment will probably take you about 1/2 hour.

task.name: A) Write Your Structural Tension Document

text.p: If you click on Casey’s Structural Tension you will get a pdf file of how Casey created a Structural Tension diagram between her Current Reality (summer between her Sophomore & Junior year) and her Intermediate End Result #1 (age 22 = graduation from college). It shows her objectives for those two years.
If you click on Madison’s Structural Tension you will get a pdf file of how Madison created a Structural Tension diagram.

If you click on Edward’s Structural Tension you will get a pdf file of how Edward created Structural Tension diagram between his Current Reality (start of his senior year) and his Intermediate End Result #1 (end of his senior year). Because of the nature of his 3 potential career paths he had to make his Intermediate End Result #1 be closer in than suggested.

At the end of Casey, Madison and Edward’s Structural Tension documents you will see a section titled “Insights”. In that section they provide the insights they gained by doing this exercise. For example Casey’s Insights are:

Doing this Structural Tension exercise sure brought me back to reality. It made me focus on the fact that I am not going to be a Director unless I reach my first objective “I am an intern at either one of the top clothing design companies or top marketing professionals at one of the top clothing companies.”

When I came up with the list of five things I need to accomplish in the next two years it made me realize I have a lot of hard work in front of me. But I can now see it can lead to something great. I actually don’t know if I really want to pursue that exact path but I think those 5 objectives are the right ones for me because I am going to do something in that general area.

By focusing on these small steps, it will make the process of attaining my first intermediate end result a lot more manageable. I know now that I must work hard to attain these goals, in order to ultimately achieve my dream.
Edward also has insights at the end of his Structural Tension document. Rather than showing them in total here is a summary:

If I took either the Business or Legal path I had to make that decision by January of my senior year, i.e in only 6 months. This was because they both required me to go to graduate school and I would need to apply to either an MBA Program or a Law school by then. Even before than I need to be doing preparation work on those two paths. I was clearly behind in making my career decision.
Now you need to add your own Insights to your Structural Tension document.
